com.fluidops.iwb.util

Class RepositoryFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fluidops.iwb.util.RepositoryFactory

  • public class RepositoryFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Repository Factory to load supported and custom Repositories via getRepository(String). Supported Types:
    • native: NativeRepositoryFactory
    • memory: MemoryRepositoryFactory
    • owlim | bigowlim: OwlimRepositoryFactory
    • remoterepository: RemoteRepositoryFactory
    • sparql: SparqlRepositoryFactory
    • fedx: FedXRepositoryFactory
    • class=com.MyRepositoryFactory: CustomRepositoryFactory
    To load a custom repository set repositoryType = class=com.mypackage.MyRepositoryFactory where MyRepositoryFactory extends RepositoryFactory.RepositoryFactoryBase and provides a default constructor.
    Author:
    as

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  RepositoryFactory.RepositoryFactoryBase
      Abstract base class for any RepositoryFactory.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RepositoryFactory() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static org.openrdf.repository.Repository getHistoryRepository()
      Return the repository used for historical data.
      static org.openrdf.repository.Repository getMemoryRepositoryWithoutPersistence()
      Return a repository that stores the data in memory and that does not perform I/O (not even for persistence, which actually cannot happen).
      static org.openrdf.repository.Repository getMemoryRepositoryWithPersistence(java.io.File persistenceFile)
      Return a repository that stores the data in memory that can persist the data in the location provided as persistenceFile.
      static org.openrdf.repository.Repository getNativeRepository(java.lang.String repositoryName)
      Create a new NativeStore with a given repository name.
      static org.openrdf.repository.Repository getOwlimRepository(java.lang.String repositoryName)
      Create a new OWLIM store with given repository location
      static org.openrdf.repository.Repository getRemoteRepository(java.lang.String repositoryServer, java.lang.String repositoryName)
      Return a new remote repository instance for the given settings
      static org.openrdf.repository.Repository getRepository(java.lang.String repositoryType)
      Return the repository matching the provided repositoryType.
      static org.openrdf.repository.Repository getSPARQLRepository(java.lang.String endpoint)
      Create a SPARQL repository for the given endpoint
      static org.openrdf.repository.Repository getSPARQLRepository(java.lang.String endpoint, java.lang.String user, java.lang.String pass)
      Create a SPARQL repository for the given endpoint using the provided user credentials for basic authentication
      static org.openrdf.repository.sail.SailRepository getWikiLuceneSailRepository()
      Return a new LuceneSail repository for wiki pages indexing.

      • getRepository

        public static org.openrdf.repository.Repository getRepository(java.lang.String repositoryType)
                                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Return the repository matching the provided repositoryType.

        Supported Types:

        • native: NativeRepositoryFactory
        • memory: MemoryRepositoryFactory
        • owlim | bigowlim: OwlimRepositoryFactory
        • swiftowlim: SwiftOwlimRepositoryFactory
        • remoterepository: RemoteRepositoryFactory
        • httprepository: HttpRepositoryFactory
        • sparql: SparqlRepositoryFactory
        • fedx: FedXRepositoryFactory
        • class=com.MyRepositoryFactory: CustomRepositoryFactory
        To load a custom repository set repositoryType = class=com.mypackage.MyRepositoryFactory where MyRepositoryFactory extends RepositoryFactory.RepositoryFactoryBase and provides a default constructor.
        Parameters:
        repositoryType -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getHistoryRepository

        public static org.openrdf.repository.Repository getHistoryRepository()
        Return the repository used for historical data. The name is of the repository is given by Config.getHistoryRepositoryName() and defaults to historymodel. Note that the following native store indices are created: "cspo,cpso,cops"
        Returns:

      • getMemoryRepositoryWithPersistence

        public static org.openrdf.repository.Repository getMemoryRepositoryWithPersistence(java.io.File persistenceFile)
        Return a repository that stores the data in memory that can persist the data in the location provided as persistenceFile.

      • getMemoryRepositoryWithoutPersistence

        public static org.openrdf.repository.Repository getMemoryRepositoryWithoutPersistence()
        Return a repository that stores the data in memory and that does not perform I/O (not even for persistence, which actually cannot happen).
